original_title: Sri Lanka T-bill auction yields slightly up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields rose across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with only 145 billion of the offered bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 98.5 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.82 percent, up 08 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 80 billion rupees.
26.1 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.42 percent, up 15 basis points from a week earlier after offering 30 billion rupees.
20.5 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 23.14 percent, up 14 basis points from a week earlier after offering 50 billion. (Colombo/ May03/2023)
